That day, he goes to the roof of the school to practice his "Dragon Unit", a flight pack. Just as he's about to test it out, he sees a girl falling out of the sky, wearing a similar device. He tries to save her, but fails and falls to his death. However, several seconds later, he finds himself having gone back in time a few seconds ago (though he has no memory of it) with the same incident occurring.

179016.Name: Danball Senki Boost
179016.Overview: Danball Senki Boost is a Role-Playing game, developed and published by Level 5, which was released in Japan in 2011.

179017.Name: Dragon Dance
179017.Overview: Dragon Dance is a Puzzle game, developed by Always Neat and published by Success, which was released in Japan in 2009.

AltNames.Name: あの日見た花の名前を僕達はまだ知らない。

179439.Name: Ano Hi Mita Hana no Namae o Bokutachi wa Mada Shiranai
179439.Overview: Based on the popular anime and manga of the same name, Ano Hi Mita Hana no Namae o Bokutachi wa Mada Shiranai follows several childhood friends who try to reconnect in high school after drifting apart. Featuring music from the anime series, the game also contains new scenarios not seen before.

AltNames.Name: Blue Exorcist: The Phantom Labyrinth of Time

179441.Name: Ao no Exorcist: Genkoku no Labyrinth
179441.Overview:
Blue Exorcist: The Chronocyclic Labyrinth is a PSP game produced by Namco Bandai, based on the anime and manga of Blue Exorcist.

It was released April 26th, 2012 in Japan, and came in two editions: a regular edition and a limited edition entitled the "Blue Flame Box" edition, which came with an original drama DVD, a character booklet, a clear postcard with the cover design signed by Kazue Katō, and a paper craft cutout figure of Kuro - all housed in a cardboard box. First pressings of the game came with an original card in the game case which held a download serial code for a PSP theme.

The game featured an original story with the following plot:

Birthed between Satan and a human priestess, Rin and his brother Yukio are destined for great things and terrible dangers. Enter the school for the exorcists, deepen the bond between the brothers. Your final aim is to create a world where Demons can coexist with humans, so start off in school. Become friends with your classmates, and fight Demons that come across your path together.

179442.Name: Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu Portable
179442.Overview:
Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu Portable was released for the PlayStation Portable on December 13, 2012 in regular and limited edition box set.

The game is featured as a board/adventure game genre along with the following: Summoned Beast Battles, Recovery Tests, Roulette, Cards, Classroom Equipments, Exam and Grade Points. Player will have 4 default characters to be used in the beginning of the game (Akihisa, Yuuji, Hideyoshi and Kouta) and every character, three stages are to be played. As the player continues on the game, 5 more characters and extras will be unlocked.

In each stage, 4 players will battle (Red, Orange, Green and Purple). In order to progress in the game, the player must roll the roulette, move, gain money and cards, Equipments, Exam and Grade Points. The main goal of the game is to win the 1st Place by having the highest money and GP, ending the given number of turns having the 1st place, and/or eliminating other players, having the highest amount of points.

179443.Name: Shinseiki GPX Cyber Formula VS
179443.Overview: Shinseiki GPX Cyber Formula VS is a Racing game, developed and published by Sunrise Interactive, which was released in Japan in 2008.

179444.Name: Dies irae: Amantes Amentes
179444.Overview: Dies irae: Amantes Amentes is an Adventure game, developed and published by Views, which was released in Japan in 2012.

179445.Name: Misshitsu no Sacrifice
179445.Overview:
Maki wakes up on the floor of a strange room. Water is seeping in from the ceiling, and her leg is trapped under rubble. She doesn't know where she is or how she got there, only that she must find a way out. A strange, futuristic complex, seemingly deserted after some unknown disaster. Other survivors are elsewhere in the complex, but what their intentions are is yet unknown.

Misshitsu no Sacrifice (Sacrifice of the Secret Room) is a Japanese visual novel combined with western adventure-game-style item and logic puzzles. The game is divided into numerous short chapters, each played from a specific character's perspective, each of which includes a handful of puzzles in addition to fully-voiced story sequences. After each chapter, the player much choose which character to play next, and the outcome of the story will change depending on what order the chapters are played.

In "Search Mode", the player is presented with still images of the scene. The player can investigate areas of interest by clicking on them, picking up useful items and finding out more about the environment. Collected items may also need to be used together or combined in order to solve puzzles. Movement is generally limited to only one or a handful of rooms, with the story moving forward automatically after puzzles have been solved, and all information and items needed for that area are found there.

179446.Name: Misshitsu no Sacrifice
179446.Overview:
Maki wakes up on the floor of a strange room. Water is seeping in from the ceiling, and her leg is trapped under rubble. She doesn't know where she is or how she got there, only that she must find a way out. A strange, futuristic complex, seemingly deserted after some unknown disaster. Other survivors are elsewhere in the complex, but what their intentions are is yet unknown.

Misshitsu no Sacrifice (Sacrifice of the Secret Room) is a Japanese visual novel combined with western adventure-game-style item and logic puzzles. The game is divided into numerous short chapters, each played from a specific character's perspective, each of which includes a handful of puzzles in addition to fully-voiced story sequences. After each chapter, the player much choose which character to play next, and the outcome of the story will change depending on what order the chapters are played.

In "Search Mode", the player is presented with still images of the scene. The player can investigate areas of interest by clicking on them, picking up useful items and finding out more about the environment. Collected items may also need to be used together or combined in order to solve puzzles. Movement is generally limited to only one or a handful of rooms, with the story moving forward automatically after puzzles have been solved, and all information and items needed for that area are found there.

179448.Name: Routes Portable
179448.Overview:
Routes Portable is an adult visual novel originally produced by Leaf for Windows titled "Routes". It was the fourth volume in the Leaf visual novel Series, and was released in 2003, six years after the third, To Heart. The CD-ROM version was released on 28 February 2003, whereas the DVD version, which contained additional CGs, was released on 28 November 2003.

A remake of the game was released by Aquaplus on 25 January 2007, for the PlayStation 2 and the PlayStation Portable. The remake for PlayStation 2 was entitled Routes PE while the PlayStation Portable port of the remake was named Routes PORTABLE in Japan. The new version had voice acting and was no longer rated 18+.

179449.Name: Saki: Achiga-Hen Episode of Side-A Portable
179449.Overview: Saki: Achiga-Hen Episode of Side-A Portable is an Mahjong game, developed and published by Alchemist, which was released in Japan in 2013.

179450.Name: Sengoku Hime 4: Souha Hyakkei, Hana Mamoru Chikai
179450.Overview: Sengoku Hime 4: Souha Hyakkei, Hana Mamoru Chikai is an Adventure game, developed by Unicorn-A and published by SystemSoft Alpha, which was released in Japan in 2014.

179451.Name: Senritsu no Stratus
179451.Overview:
Terror of the Stratus, known in Japan as Senritsu no Stratus is an action video game developed by Nude Maker and published by Konami for the PlayStation Portable. It was released in Japan on October 27, 2011.

The game has two different main gameplay modes. In "extermination mode", the game plays much like a 3D third person shooter, while in "defense mode", the game plays like a 2D sidescroller.

179453.Name: Tiger & Bunny: On-Air Jack
179453.Overview: Tiger & Bunny: On-Air Jack! is an Action game, developed by NATSUME ATARI Inc. and published by Bandai Namco Games, which was released in Japan in 2012.

179454.Name: Weiss Schwarz Portable: 2nd Turn
179454.Overview:
Weiss Schwarz Portable 2nd Turn is an expansion for Weiss Schwarz Portable that allows you to fight against some of the series characters.

Each character's voice is used as the announcer.

It uses the save data from the main Weiss Schwarz Portable games and has a challenge mode. Once you beat any character you can choose her for a single battle.

179471.Name: Busou Shinki: Battle Masters
179471.Overview:
Busou Shinki is a product line of small, armored women action-figure toys manufactured by Konami Digital Entertainment first released in Japan in 2006. The figures can be configured in different poses and feature a variety of interchangeable parts. Many of the figures have been designed by noted Japanese artists. A few of the figures have been released for distribution outside Japan. Since their introduction this toy line has spawned a media franchise with video games, manga series, graphic novels, anime series, music, art books and other merchandise.

Busou Shinki Battle Masters was developed by Konami for the PlayStation Portable released July 15, 2010. The release included a limited edition bundle with new action figures.

A sequel PSP game, Busou Shinki Battle Masters Mk.2 was released on September 22, 2011 that also included a limited edition bundle with new action figures.

179519.Name: Maid Paradise Mezase! Maid Number One!
179519.Overview: Maid Paradise Mezase! Maid Number One! is an adventure game, developed and published by Spike, which was released in Japan in 2011.

179520.Name: Super Robot Taisen OE: Operation Extend
179520.Overview:
Super Robot Taisen OE: Operation Extend is a strategy game, developed by Banpresto and published by Bandai Namco Games, which was released in Japan in 2013.

OE is a curious installment as it wasn't released in a physical format, but rather digital-only, with a total of eight chapters. The goal of the game was to try to use as many series as possible in a single installment, using the PlayStation Network to upload more content with each specific chapter.

179817.Name: Cart Kings
179817.Overview: Cart Kings is a Racing game, developed by Gameshastra Inc. and published by SCEE, which was released in Asia in 2011.

179818.Name: Kenka Banchou Bros. Tokyo Battle Royal
179818.Overview: Men use their fists to connect with each other. Kenka Banchou Bros bring a pair of boys as partners into the fray. Ikki and Kousuke are both from dysfunctional families, fights, ambition and each other are all they have. Players start off by choosing the boy they want to become and proceed the game through a series of missions.Since friendship is such an important aspect, gamers are encouraged to connect with others through the adhoc mode. Pair up, watch each others' back as you embark on a school trip to fight for the title of the Banchou of the banchous.

179819.Name: Kenka Banchou Portable
179819.Overview: Kenka Banchou Portable is an Action game, developed and published by Spike, which was released in Japan in October 29, 2009.

179820.Name: Kinnikuman: Muscle Generations
179820.Overview: Kinnikuman: Muscle Generations is a Sports game, developed by Bandai and published by Aki Corp., which was released in Japan in 2006.

179821.Name: Minna no Golf: Portable: Coca Cola Special Edition
179821.Overview: This is a specially Coca Cola branded version of Hot Shots Golf Open Tee. The game is the same except that there is a Coca Cola theme to everything. The characters wear Coke's red-and-white colors, there are Coke branded billboards, Coke "thought bubbles", even Coke bottle-shaped golf clubs and the game comes in a Coke themed package. This was given away in a Coke Style special giveaway with a Coca Cola branded PlayStation Portable. Only 1300 copies of this game were made.

179826.Name: Oretachi no Sabage Portable
179826.Overview: Oretachi no Sabage Portable is an Action game, developed and published by Best Media, which was released in Japan in 2008.

179827.Name: Oretachi no Sabage Versus
179827.Overview: Bring your war game in doors. The biggest air gun manufacturer in Japan and army-wear maker joined forces in creating Oretachi no Sabage Versus. Unlike the last installment, this game uses a FPS system that makes the action and the bullet rain even more real and the adhoc network mode allows 8 soldiers to fight in this war.

179828.Name: Othello
179828.Overview:
The well-acclaimed board game for all ages, Othello, is now on Sony PSP! Play in the comfort of your home or outside, and play in a style that suits you best!

A total of 16 levels of computer AI difficulty are available for single-player modes! Hints on where the stones can be placed, and displays to show which tiles will be flipped in this move are also available to help new players understand the game better!

179829.Name: Plus Plum 2 Again Portable
179829.Overview: Plus Plum 2 Again Portable is a Puzzle game, developed and published by Takuyo, which was released in Japan in 2006.

AltNames.Name: Rupupu Cube - Lup Salad Portable Matatabi

179830.Name: Lup Salad Portable Matatabi: Lupupu Cube
179830.Overview: Lup Salad Portable Matatabi: Lupupu Cube is a Puzzle game, developed and published by Dimple Entertainment, which was released in Japan in 2010.

179831.Name: Simple 2500 Series Portable!! Vol.1: The Table Game
179831.Overview: The Table Game is a Miscellaneous game, developed by Yuki and published by D3Publisher, which was released in Japan in 2005.

179833.Name: Simple 2500 Series Portable Vol. 6: The Sensha
179833.Overview: The Sensha is a Simulation game, developed and published by D3Publisher, which was released in Japan in 2006.

179834.Name: Taisen Chess
179834.Overview: Taisen Chess is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Best Media, which was released in Japan in 2010.

179835.Name: Taisen Gindan Shooting
179835.Overview: Taisen Gindan Shooting is an Action game, developed and published by Best Media, which was released in Japan in 2011.

179836.Name: Simple 2500 Series Portable Vol.12: The Hohei 2 Senyuu yo Sakini Ike
179836.Overview: The Hohei 2: Senyuu yo, Saki ni Ike is an Action game, developed and published by D3Publisher, which was released in Japan in 2009.

179841.Name: Taisen Obake Choice
179841.Overview: Taisen Obake Choice is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Best Media, which was released in Japan in 2011.

179842.Name: Taisen Reversi
179842.Overview: Taisen Reversi is a Miscellaneous game, developed by X-Road and published by Best Media, which was released in Japan in 2010.

179843.Name: Taisen Sensuikan Sweeper
179843.Overview: Taisen Sensuikan Sweeper is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Best Media, which was released in Japan in 2011.

179844.Name: War Ni Chi
179844.Overview: The Kingdom of War Ni Chi has fallen into chaos! The joy of festivals no longer exists, homes are in ruins, homeless children are wandering everywhere ... In order to let the villages enjoy peace again, Preffy will use his extraordinary memory, logic and action to start a period of solution Jigsaw puzzle journey. Let's enter the WarNiChi kingdom that is in chaos, visit the villages in depth, and solve the problems for them!

179858.Name: World Soccer Winning Eleven 2010: Aoki Samurai no Chousen
179858.Overview: World Soccer Winning Eleven 2010: Aoki Samurai no Chousen is a Sports game, developed and published by Konami, which was released in Japan in 2010.

179882.Name: Simple 2500 Series Portable Vol.4: The Unou Drill
179882.Overview: The Unou Drill is a Puzzle game, developed by Luxe and published by D3Publisher, which was released in Japan in 2006.

179922.Name: Arthur and the Minimoys
179922.Overview:
Arthur And The Minimoys is an action-adventure based on the animated film from Luc Besson. It follows the film's storyline and lets you relive the young Arthur's and his two friends', princess Selenia and her brother Bétamèche, adventures in the fantastic world of Minimoys. Save the Minimoys from certain destruction while enjoying the eye-popping graphics and technical innovations.

The game features "trio"-gameplay in which you have to utilize all the three characters and their special abilities to fight, solve puzzles, fly and drive. The game offers over 20 hours of gameplay plus additional "integrated scenes from the film offered in the form of parallel action phases."

AltNames.Name: ナムコミュージアム Vol. 2

179967.Name: Namco Museum vol. 2
179967.Overview: The second of the series for PSP, this compilation offers thirteen arcade classics in their original form along with two remakes. Arcade titles include King & Balloon (1980), Bosconian (1981), Xevious (1983), Mappy (1983), Tower of Druaga (1984), Grobda (1984), Dragon Buster (1985), Dig Dug II (1985), Motos (1985), Rolling Thunder (1986) and Dragon Spirit (1987). Also included are Pac Man Arrangement Plus and Motos Arrangement, updated version of the arcade originals featuring 3D visuals and wireless play for up to four players. In addition to all this classic arcade gaming, Namco will be including sample versions of seven titles from the original Namco Museum. Players will be able to send these samples, as well as samples of King & Balloon, Bosconian and Xevious, to another PSP to let friends experience classic Namco arcade gaming.

179968.Name: Musou Orochi 2 Special
179968.Overview:
Bring your battlefield into the train or onto the bus. Musou Orochi 2 Special is now available on the Sony PSP. Game saves from the PlayStation3 version can be ported to the PSP so you have access to your handy warriors right from the start. Besides everything in the existing games, gamers also get to play with a set of original characters only accessible here. New to the Orochi universe is Rachel the demon hunter from Ninja Gaiden 2. This kind of adventure is right up her ally, loop her into your party and take her on a conquest.

The new Battle Royal mode gives players a battle field to butt heads with fellow warriors they know in real life. Make use of the ad hoc network mode. These battles have special rules that make everything extra challenging.

179969.Name: TalkMan Euro
179969.Overview: Following the success of the Asian version of Talkman, a version designed for translating European languages was developed and released on June 16, 2006. Talkman Euro is available in two versions. The Japanese version contains support for English, Italian, Spanish, German, French, and Japanese, while the Chinese version contains support for Traditional Chinese instead of Japanese. The differences on the packaging (the Japanese flag as opposed to a flag with the word "mie" in Chinese) are minimal and hard to notice.

179987.Name: Namco Museum
179987.Overview:
This is the first Namco Museum title to use actual arcade roms to run the games through emulation, which is done fairly good here. It also includes its own Arrangement titles, although they have nothing to do with their 1990s counterparts seen in the previous Namco Museum title.

You also can play with others, or share a game with another using the Ad-Hoc mode on the PSP to wirelessly transmit a demo of one game, or play together in multiplayer, although playing multiplayer requires two copies of the game.

183736.Name: Custom Drive
183736.Overview: Custom Drive is an Adventure game, developed by Vridge and published by D3Publisher, which was released in Japan in 2012.

183740.Name: Fatal Fury
183740.Overview:
Southtown City plays host to the King of Fighters Tournament. Andy & Terry Bogard take part in the tournament cause winning the tournament is the only way they can defeat Geese Howard. Geese Howard controls Southtown City and killed their father several years ago. Also taking part is Joe Higashi, a Japanese kickboxer. Select either Joe, Andy or Terry, visit several locations in Southtown City and win that tournament!

Fatal Fury is a 2D fighter and is the first game in a series of one-on-one fighting games by SNK. It's a conversion of the original Fatal Fury arcade game.

184385.Name: Circles
184385.Overview:
The game idea of the circles is inspired from a war strategy called “Chakravigua” described in the Indian epic Mahabharata. The Sanskrit word Chakravigua means Circle strategy where a battalion forms a circle around the king to protect him.

Circle puzzle is designed in similar fashion. The player’s circles (Blue small circles) are distributed in border of big circle where the objective is to move the blue circle toward zero to conquer it. Defending player’s circles (orange small circles) are distributed around the golden zero where the object is to destroy the all the blue circles. 

Moving the circle around works based on simple logic which described in game mechanics section. The player can destroy the opponent circles using simple math skills like (5+3 =?), (4-2 =?). 

Features
• Three difficulty modes (Easy, Medium & Hard). 
• 40 levels in each mode 
• 120 total levels 

Key control
• Directional keys is used to move the cursor
• The cursor color will change on rotatable circles. 
• Right Trigger is used to rotate the selected circle in clockwise direction. 
• Left Trigger is used to rotate the selected circle in anticlockwise direction. 
• Triangle Button is used to restart the button. Conformation window will pop-up on the triangle button press.

184386.Name: PlayStation Network Collection: Puzzle Pack
184386.Overview:
Three PSP games, on one UMD, tailored for puzzle fans.

Lemmings
The Lemmings are on the loose and that can only mean one thing - trouble! Danger is barely a footstep away for the relentlessly marching hordes of cutesy, green-haired rodents.

Go! Sudoku
The crazily addictive phenomenon of Sudoku reaches new levels on PSP. Simple logic is the key to unlocking the number based puzzles.

Go! Puzzle
Easy to play but tricky to master, Go! Puzzle features three addictive games - Go! Puzzle Aquatica, Go! Puzzle Swizzle Blocks and Go! Puzzle Skyscraper.

184388.Name: Spot the Differences!
184388.Overview: Try your hand at spotting the differences in 240 scenes, with four levels of difficulty, three game modes and 4,800 differences to spot!

184389.Name: Stand O' Food
184389.Overview:
Manage your time and a restaurant in this non-stop cooking challenge

Feed crowds of hungry customers as they pile into your restaurant for lunch.
With over 80 sandwiches to create, it’s all about time management and perfection.
Stay entertained for hours on end with over 100 levels, 20 upgrades to purchase and 2 gameplay modes.

184391.Name: Batman Arkham Asylum: The Road To Arkham
184391.Overview:
The road to Arkham offers readers the chance to experience firsthand the story of how Batman™ single-handedly brought two of Gotham's hardest criminals to the asylum. Follow the in-depth story behind the capture of Zsasz and The Joker and along the way uncover additional hidden secrets surrounding the goings on in Arkham. 

© 2009 Eidos Interactive Ltd. Co-published by Eidos, Inc. and Warner Bros.Interactive Entertainment, a division of Warner Bros. Home Entertainment Inc. 

Purchase or use of this item is subject to the PlayStation®Network Terms of Service and User Agreement. If you do not wish to accept all these terms, do not purchase or use this item. This item has been sublicensed to you by Sony Computer Entertainment America. One-time license fee for downloads to up to 2 portable systems that are associated with the purchasing account.

184392.Name: Echochrome Expansion
184392.Overview:
Compatible with PSP® (PlayStation®Portable) and PlayStation®Vita. In order to download and install this product, 52 MB is required. 
Enter puzzle paradise with this Expansion Pack for echochrome micro, which contains 40 new mazes to challenge your powers of visual perception. 

Guide the mysterious Walker around each of the 3D levels on the hunt for ‘Echoes’. But beware: chasms, launch-pads and dead ends block the path, rendering your quest impossible… or so it may seem. 

In fact, by changing the angle at which you view the action, you can remove obstacles and create new paths for the Walker to follow. It’s marvellously mind-bending stuff and great fun for all ages – and with this Expansion Pack, you can go on exercising your imagination even longer. Download it today and put your brain to the ultimate test! 

Reminder: in order to use this download, you need to own echochrome micro. 

NOTE: this information was correct at the time of publication.

Full Game Support 
1 Player; Memory Stick Duo™ Compatible: 1408KB minimum, Wireless Compatible (Ad Hoc Mode)

AltNames.Name: James Bond 007: From Russia with Love

184393.Name: From Russia with Love 007
184393.Overview: Inspired by the 1963 movie of the same name, From Russia with Love lets you play as the classic James Bond as portrayed by Sean Connery. You can drive in classic cars and use upgradeable weapons and gadgetry to complete the game's nonlinear missions. From Russia with Love also lets you invest in and upgrade your character to customize his performance.

184394.Name: Let's Golf
184394.Overview: Grab a club, take a swing, and pray for a birdie! It’s time to become a big hitter and start playing Let’s Golf! Play the first PSP® (PlayStation®Portable) go family golf game and discover a fun-filled experience accessible to anyone. Choose from among the 4 customizable characters, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Then challenge 63 holes in 4 beautiful locations created in full 3D including Fiji Beach, the American Mountains, the English Countryside, and the Scottish Lochs. Have even more fun by playing hot seat multiplayer with friends (on the same PSP® system) and see who's the best! Golf games have never been so accessible and fun!

184396.Name: Promethus
184396.Overview:
You are the renowned space mercenary Angel. Your mission is to infiltrate the seemingly peaceful planet of Promethus and uncover the plot of the Evil Lord Duroth. Recover and use the energy blaster, katana, grenades and whip to vanquish the enemies. Uncover ancient promethan relics and crystals to powerup your attacks. Little does she realize the depth of the deception, and the perilous adventure that will decide the fate of the known galaxy that awaits her on the planet Promethus.

Touted as an “old school platformer” in the style of Super Metroid, Promethus was to feature an open map layout with access gated by special abilities acquired through exploration and combat. It was revealed to be in development in mid-to-late 2009 and the demo claimed it would be released “later this year (in 2009)”. The Promethus demo was removed from the PlayStation Store for PlayStation Portable between December 2009 and early 2010 after the dissolution of developer GeeKay Soft in January.

184855.Name: The King of Fighters '94
184855.Overview:
THE KING OF FIGHTERS '94, the first game hailed as a dream match of SNK characters, makes its way to the NEOGEO STATION! Still beloved by countless fans, its revolutionary three-on-three team battle system sets it apart from all other fighting games.
And of course, this NEOGEO STATION port allows you to test your skills against another player through an Ad Hoc connection in Network Mode, record your local gameplay with Replay Mode, and listen to game music in the SOUND PLAYER for even more fun!

The Ad Hoc functionality of this software will not work on PSP®1000 systems.

184856.Name: The King of Fighters '95
184856.Overview: The 2nd installment of the series, THE KING OF FIGHTERS '95, is back on NEOGEO Station! The introduction of the Team Edit System makes it possible to create original teams for even more intense battles! Also, KOF '95 is the start of the Orochi Saga in which IORI YAGAMI appears for the first time!

184857.Name: The King of Fighters '96
184857.Overview:
Play with your favorite characters and newcomers such as the Play with your favorite characters and newcomers such as the mysterious Leona and the legendary Geese Howard, Wolfgang Krauser, and Mr. Big in this third installment of the popular "3-on-3" versus fighting series from SNK! With its unforgettable cast of 27 characters, and over 2,900 possible team combinations, KOF '96 promises endless, intense battles on NEOGEO Station!

Furthermore, the pleasure of this title has been increased with the many options featured in NEOGEO Station: challenge players worldwide via the "NETWORK MODE", save and replay your gameplay any time with the "REPLAY MODE", and listen to the in-game music (BGM) with the "SOUND PLAYER"!!

184858.Name: Metal Slug
184858.Overview:
Metal Slug is a run and gun video game developed and originally released by Nazca Corporation and later published by SNK. It was originally released in 1996 for the Neo Geo MVS arcade platform. The game is widely known for its sense of humor, fluid hand-drawn animation, and fast-paced two-player action.

The player(s) must shoot constantly at a continual stream of enemies in order to reach the end of each level. At this point, the player confronts a boss, who is usually considerably larger and tougher than regular enemies. On the way through each level, the player can find numerous weapon upgrades and "Metal Slug" tanks. The tank is known as the SV-001 ("SV" stands for Super Vehicle), which not only increases the player's offense, but considerably adds to their defense.

In addition to shooting, the player can also perform melee attacks by using a knife. The player does not die simply by coming into contact with enemies, and correspondingly, many of the enemy troops also have melee attacks. Much of the game's scenery is also destructible, and occasionally, this reveals extra items or power-ups, although most of the time it simply results in collateral damage.

During the course of a level, the player also encounters POWs, who, if freed, offer the player bonuses in the form of random items or weapons. At the end of each level, the player receives a scoring bonus based on the number of freed POWs. If the player dies before the end of the level, the tally of freed POWs reverts to zero.

There are a total of six levels, in locations such as forests, garrisoned cities, snowy mountain valleys, canyons, and military bases. The vast majority of enemies are soldiers equipped with weaponry befitting their specific role. There are also several mechanized enemies, such as tanks, mobile artillery, aircraft, armored personnel carriers and technicals. Much of the game's humor comes from how the enemies are depicted; the player often encounters them as they are sunbathing, roasting food over a fire, or simply conversing amongst themselves. They also tend to scream loudly if they see the player, and often try to either run away or fight back.

The American version changed the color of the soldiers' blood from red to white.

186222.Name: San Goku Shi V
186222.Overview:
The series are based on the romanticized Romance of the Three Kingdoms novel and the historical text Records of the Three Kingdoms, the storyline takes place during the Han Dynasty in China with many warring factions that included the Shu Han, Cao Wei and Eastern Wu kingdoms. Gameplay revolves around managing numerical statistics, each representing an attribute of a city or a character. A city is described by statistics such as stored grain supplies, vulnerability to disasters such as floods and earthquakes, treasury funds, domestic affairs and populace loyalty. Characters are numerically characterized by their leadership abilities, melee prowess, intellects and loyalty, as well as special traits or even magical abilities that can be called upon whether during wartime, diplomacy or domestic affairs. Players can increase these numbers before waging war on neighbouring territories or intending diplomatic efforts.

While generally presented as a turn-based strategy game, the seventh, eighth and tenth editions offer role-playing features, allowing the player to play as a rank-and-file character instead of leading a kingdom.

Several spin-offs based on the series include the tactical action hack and slash video game Dynasty Warriors, Dynasty Tactics which is a hybrid of Dynasty Warriors and Romance of the Three Kingdoms, as well as the three tactical role-playing games Sangokushi Eiketsuden (Liu Bei), Sangokushi Koumeiden (Zhuge Liang), and Sangokushi Sousouden (Cao Cao). Kessen II is a real-time tactics game on PS2.

187806.Name: The Terminator
187806.Overview: The Terminator for iPhone is an explosive top-down all action shooter based on the original, and best, of the Terminator series, featuring both a Story Mode and Endless (Quick Play) Mode.Quick Play: select your weapon of choice from Pistols, Assault Rifles, Gatling guns and Bazookas, destroy as many of the machines as you can without falling to the enemy. Save injured Tech-Com soldiers and collect salvage for bonus points, improve your kill stats as you increase your combat expertise.Story Mode presents a back-story leading up to the beginning of The Terminator movie. 2029, The machines are winning the war. Our future is very much in doubt. Skynet is about to complete its time displacement device.You play a young Kyle Reese sent on a mission that will unravel a sequence of events which will pave the way to finding and saving John Connor, the only hope for Mankind in it's desperate struggle against the machine intelligence, SkyNet.Features:- Bigger and badder weapons from Gatling guns to Bazookas- Two extreme game modes for a lasting game experience- Quick mode, rescue fallen soldiers- Story mode, play as Kyle Reese taking on challenging missions.- T-800s and Hunter Killer Tanks from the original movie along with an array of new foes- Multiple control modes and auto targeting options to match gameplay to every skill level.- Pounding soundtrack and sfx, play this game with headphones for a film like experience.VERSION 1.1 features:- Episode 2 storyline, continues the search for Jon Connor- 7 new stunning maps- A new enemy type- A new weapon: Lightning Gun- Improved explosions- Improved AI- Improved framerate & touch responses- Improved objectives mechanic- Three new difficulty modes- Global High Scores (requires Network connection)For even more explosive adventures in The Terminator universe, browse the Dark Horse Comics Digital Editions of The Terminator graphic novels, especially adapted for the iPhone and iPod Touch, and now available in the App Store.The Terminator for iPhone is for gamers who love casual action games, big explosions, and lots of noise.We’ll be back.Check out our other titles on YouTube and Facebook http://www.facebook.com/pages/Big-Head-Games/111113905597058--------------------------------------

189482.Name: Alpha Mission II
189482.Overview: Alpha Mission II is a top-down, vertically-scrolling shooter and the sequel to Alpha Mission. When the game starts the player picks two armors for their SYD, and additional armors can be purchased at the end of each level. Armors add additional firepower to the ship while equipped, and will be destroyed when shot, saving the ship from one hit. The SYD's primary weapons, a straight ahead laser and falling bombs, can be upgraded from icons dropped by specific enemies. Similarly to Xevious ground targets can only be hit by bombs, while aerial targets can only be hit by lasers.

189498.Name: Bakumatsu Revolution
189498.Overview:
A dungeon-crawl of an RPG that lampoons important personages from mid-19th century Japan in various scandalous ways. 

Bakumatsu Revolution is essentially a "freemium" game: the basic game was free to download but to enjoy the full experience you had to purchase additional DLCs from the PSN network.

189550.Name: Boku wa Kimi Dake wo Mitsumeru
189550.Overview:
The protagonist Sahara Takumi was feared as the leader of the juvenile gangster group “Sabre-tooth Tiger”. Some people in the underworld even called him devil’s incarnate, and so far the police has been unable to capture him.

Then suddenly two of his best friends are killed by an assassin employed by the mafia. The event marked the downfall of Sabre-tooth Tiger and Takumi made sure he stayed out of public attention. Seeking revenge for his comrades and a way to rise up from this nightmare, the protagonist accepts a job as a bodyguard.

189673.Name: Dongfang Queshen
189673.Overview:
Using playing rules of China, Hong Kong and Taiwan, this authentic and first Chinese Mahjong game developed by Chinese game producers is now available on PSP.
The eight characters all have  their own characteristics and mahjong-playing habits. With detailed hand movements, colourful screen effects and lively conversations by renowned voice actors, players feel as if they are playing a real game of mahjong.

Apart from single-play, players can chose from multi-player online mode, simple tutorial mini-game that can train Mahjong skills and Challenge mode etc. Enjoy the fun of Magjong anytime and anywhere depending on your time and needs.

189682.Name: Dot Defense
189682.Overview: Dot Defense,is a retro-flavored Tower Defense-style game.

189683.Name: Dungeon Explorer II
189683.Overview:
Dungeon Explorer II is a continuation of the story told in Dungeon Explorer.  As the game supports five players, the hero who enters the throne room of Ardeen is one or more of the five to-be Immortals, with a character class of the players' choice: Fighter, Thief, Wizard, Cleric, Bard, Hunter, Dwarf or the Elf.

Dungeon Explorer II plays very similarly to its predecessor. Characters move around and talk to people in a regular RPG fashion. Since the movement is not limited to squares and it is possible to move diagonally, the game has very action-oriented gameplay. Combat is similar to that of The Legend of Zelda or Gauntlet, from a top-town view. Enemies spawn from generators and drop usable items, power-ups and provide experience as player-controlled characters kill them. Items are used in real-time and leveling up gives the characters more health.

189688.Name: Earth Saver Plus: Inseki Bakuha Daisakusen
189688.Overview: A giant meteorite is headed straight for Earth. Land your spaceship on the meteorite and set explosives to break off small pieces so the rock breaks up in Earth's atmosphere. Chunks of meteorite that are too big will smash into Earth, wiping out mankind. As an explosives expert, you can plant a series of bombs to create chain-reaction combos, easily blasting off chunks of rock the size of houses. You'll also need to tackle the many strange alien life forms you encounter by either blowing them up or cunningly blasting around the piece of rock they're standing on so they fall with the meteorite. Can you save Earth from obliteration and secure the future of mankind?

189721.Name: Galaga '88
189721.Overview:
Galaga is a smouldering planet that often erupts with angry mutants and misfits. As Galactic commander of the Federal Army, you have the job of making them dead. Not easy! Because they come at you in clusters like swarms of killer bees. This time, you will be flying the awesome Triple Proton Fighter that warps to new dimensions and increased firepower. Galaga goons, your graveyard awaits.

Galaga '88 takes the basic gameplay of Galaga and adds higher-quality graphics, triple ship abilities, parsec progression, power-ups, asteroids, bosses and other enhancements. Periodically the player encounters Challenging Stages, which are set to music and feature "dancing" enemies.

189748.Name: Metal Slug 2
189748.Overview:
As Marco, Eri, Tarma, or Fio, you must defeat the evil General Morden and his henchman. 

Metal Slug 2 is a run and gun video game developed by SNK. It was originally released in 1998 for the Neo-Geo MVS arcade platform as the sequel to the 1996 game Metal Slug. The game added several new features to the gameplay such as new weapons, vehicles and the ability to transform the character.

189754.Name: Yuusha no Kuse ni Namaikida or2

189756.Name: Kiite Oboeru Eitango: Alc No Kikutan Advanced

AltNames.Name: Fushigi no Dungeon: Fuurai no Shiren 4 Plus: Kami no Hitomi to Akuma no Heso

189758.Name: Shiren the Wanderer 4: The Eye of God and the Devil's Navel

189760.Name: Confidential Money: 300-Nichi de 3000-Man Dol Kasegu Houhou

189763.Name: Sony Computer Science Kenkyuusho Mogi Kenichirou Hakushi Kanshuu - Nou ni Kaikan Minna de Aha Taiken

189838.Name: Music Quiz
189838.Overview: Do you have an ear for music? Music Quiz is a new type of quiz game where your ears are all you've got to rely on to win. Listen carefully to the musical notes and instruments being played and be the first to choose the right one. Enjoy beating your best score in the certification mode or besting a friend in versus play.

189878.Name: World Neverland: The Nalulu Kingdom Stories
189878.Overview: The latest game in the long-running series, World Neverland: The Nalulu Kingdom Stories is a life simulation where you’re  a normal person in an abnormal world.  Make friends, work hard,  fall in love, get married. Or maybe get a pet.

190362.Name: Toaru Majutsu to Kagaku no Ensemble

190995.Name: Sampler Disc for PSP vol.1
190995.Overview: The pack-in sampler disc included with the launch of the PlayStation Portable in the US and Canada. This first release included video-only samples of several PSP titles, plus upcoming movie and music releases.

AltNames.Name: DC I and II Plus Situation Portable

192554.Name: Da Capo I & II Plus Situation Portable
192554.Overview: compilation game of D.C 1 and 2 D.C 1 The game is centered around the protagonist, Asakura Jun'ichi, who lives on a fictional japanese island named Hatsunejima peacefully attending the local Kazami Academy. His childhood friend and cousin, Yoshino Sakura, returns to the island Hatsunejima after moving to America several years ago. Most of the main stories revolve around the magical unwilting sakura tree, it's powers and mystical connection to the main characters. D.C 2 Takes place approximately 50 years after the original D.C. ~Da Capo~ game. The story revolves around Sakurai Yoshiyuki and Otome & Yume, sibling granddaughters of the original D.C. ~Da Capo~ protagonists Jun'ichi and Nemu.

192588.Name: Quest For Panic
192588.Overview:
Odyssey For Panic is a fresh Playstation Portable homebrew speed-coded game during the AC 2018 convention. It’s not a full-fledged game but should be fun for a few minutes

Goal:
Get two gifts, give these to the minotaur and leave the maze

Controls:
△ Switch ON/OFF your torch
▯ Jump
Analog nub: move

193908.Name: Atari Hits Remixed
193908.Overview: Activision Hits Remixed lets PSP® system gamers relive the dawn of home console gaming while on the go by delivering over 40 of the biggest Atari 2600 titles, such as Pitfall, Kaboom!, Chopper Command, Stampede, Keystone Kapers, to the PSP. With the game's multi-player supported classics, players can choose whether they want to game together utilizing a Game Share feature that allows two friends to play together using only one copy of the game or take turns on one PSP system or play via the game's wireless functionality. Activision Hits Remixed also features a rockin' 80's themed soundtrack, modernized front-end graphics, classic game manuals which include tips and photographs, and a host of retro unlockables.

196729.Name: Kiite Oboeru Eitango: Alc no Kikutan Basic

196730.Name: Kiite Oboeru Eitango: Alc no Kikutan Entry

196733.Name: 1 Million Ton no Barabara
196733.Overview: 1 Million Ton no Barabara is a new project of Acquire. The game this time is the inversion of “Qix”, which is a strategic puzzle game. But “Qix” is how to control a small diamond-shaped ship, draw lines to build boxes to destroy a little electric monster named “Qix”. Coming to this game, a series of warships are threatening the lives of innocent citizens, and this city fate is in your hands. Instead of building structures to defeat Ala Qix monsters, you will control a team of brave heroes to saw, cut, and break enemy warships. But the monster warships will not die immediately, and they will attack again by fire, decree, there are some creatures like spiders. They come back, rush in, attack, chase our soldiers, not only that they also try to sew the ship back to its original integrity to fly up. If we are afraid and falter at the enemy’s destructive actions, the warships will quickly drop bombs and slaughter our army. So you have to quickly reduce the ship to a specific size so that it cannot fly anymore, then the city and its inhabitants will be saved. Good luck on this journey, it will be exciting!

196744.Name: Issho ni Gohan Portable: Apartment Dinner Show

196751.Name: Taishou Yakyuujou: Otome Tatsuno Seishun Nikki

196754.Name: Shin Master of Monsters Final EX

196755.Name: World Soccer Winning Eleven 2014 Aoki Samurai no Chousen

196759.Name: Daisenryaku: Daitoua Kouboushi: Dainiji Sekai Taisen Boppatsu

196761.Name: Minna de Dokusho: Keatai Shousetsu Desu

196762.Name: Missing Parts the Tantei Stories Complete

196766.Name: Kono Bushitsu wa Kitaku Shinai Bu ga Senkyo Shimashita Portable: Gakuen Dog Ear Hen

196767.Name: Loopop Cube: Loop Salad Portable: Matatabi

196769.Name: Minna no Shiatsu: Itami mo Tsukare mo Sukirii!

196772.Name: Aoi Umi no Tristia Portable: Nanoca Flanka Hatsumei Koubouki

199001.Name: Anohana
199001.Overview: Based on the popular anime and manga of the same name, AnoHana follows several childhood friends who try to reconnect in high school after drifting apart. Featuring music from the anime series, AnoHana also contains new scenarios not seen before.

200302.Name: The Silent Hill Experience
200302.Overview:
The Silent Hill Experience is a UMD released in North America on April 6, 2006 and May 5, 2006 in Europe by Sony Entertainment for the PlayStation Portable. It is a promotional item for the Silent Hill film.

It contains a collection of digital comics, music, music videos, and several videos and trailers.

AltNames.Name: Shinten Makai Generation of Chaos V

200719.Name: Generation of Chaos V: Aedeus Memories
200719.Overview: The game world is made up of 3 different realms, the "Underground World" where mechanical and magical sciences advance on equal footing; the "Aboveground World" made up of knights and mages; and the "Sky World" where gods and devils coexist. The main character, "Kuon", is a student of a military school in the Underground World who loves to adventure, always embarking on adventures when his curiosity is piqued. One day, he encountered a mysterious girl in the hospital he was sent to for treating injuries he sustained, and that is how the story begins...

201127.Name: Digivice Ver Portable
201127.Overview: Digivice Ver. Portable is a Japanese Digimon video game for the Playstation Portable available as a download on the Playstation Network. It is an emulator of the Digimon virtual pets that was released for the 15th Anniversary.
